Package pool.poolController

Class poolController

java.lang.Object
pool.poolController.poolController
All Implemented Interfaces:
IpoolController
public class poolController extends Object implements IpoolController
This class creates and uses the poolGame. It processes mouse and key inputs and send all necessary data to the view so that the application can be drawn.

    • update

      public void update(float mX, float mY)
      This method changes the values of the variables that stand for the current location of the mouse.
      Specified by:
      update in interface IpoolController
      Parameters:
      mX - the current location of the mouse on the x-Axis
      mY - the current location of the mouse on the y-Axis

    • nextFrame

      public void nextFrame()
      This method is called every frame. It calls the draw methods of the view and calls methods in the game that are needed every frame.
      Specified by:
      nextFrame in interface IpoolController

    • keyIsPressed

      public void keyIsPressed()
      This method is called when the space key is pressed. It sets up the power of shot and the new queue position depending on the power value.
      Specified by:
      keyIsPressed in interface IpoolController

    • keyIsReleased

      public void keyIsReleased()
      This method is called when the space key is released. it then calls the shoot() method in poolGame
      Specified by:
      keyIsReleased in interface IpoolController

      public void initialize(int widthBound, int heightBound)
      This method initializes the game (adds balls).
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface IpoolController
      Parameters:
      widthBound - width of the window the game is displayed in
      heightBound - height of the window the game is displayed in
